channel.title: Seattle Central College Podcast
channel.itunes:author: Pappin/Mansoor
channel.itunes:subtitle: The Seattle Central College Podcast is a joint community-effort offering current topics and items of interest to the Seattle Central College community.
channel.itunes:summary: Offering a cultivated and open symbiotic exchange of information, Jack and Ruth engage their topics and each other with 100% honesty and curiosity, ingredients for killer cocktails that are different every time.

item.title: Episode 1 - "Inaugural podcast - The Final Frontier"
item.itunes:summary: Jack and Ruth discuss a recent factory tour of Blue Origin in Kent, Washington. They discuss commercial space travel, Amazon, Jeff Bezos and hypothesize about the future of the economic world
item.itunes:author: Pappin/Mansoor

item.title: Episode 2 - "Northwest vs. Midwest"
item.itunes:summary: Ruth and Jack compare the differences between the Northwest and Midwest regions of the US. They discuss communication styles, social norms, wallet chains, cultural convergence and society’s revolving door of progress and regression.
item.itunes:keywords: Blue Origins, Amazon, Jeff Bezos, Economy
item.itunes:author: Pappin/Mansoor

item.title: Episode 3 - "Modern Music Machine"
item.itunes:summary: Jack and Ruth discuss the Grammy Awards, hip-hop, Kendrick Lamar, Kanye West and attempt to decide the most influential female musician in modern music with one question: Beyonce or Taylor Swift?
item.itunes:keywords: Grammy Awards, Grammys, Kendrick Lamar, Kanye West, Beyonce, Taylor Swift
item.itunes:author: Pappin/Mansoor

item.title: Episode 4 - "Transplant Blues - The 'Seattle Freeze'"
item.itunes:summary: Ruth and Jack analyze the Seattle social phenomena called “The Seattle Freeze.” They discuss who is effected by the trend and the validity of resident complaints, possible sources of the antisocial behavior, and a few helpful insights from Justine Way, a Seattle Central College Humanities teacher.
item.itunes:author: Pappin/Mansoor

item.title: Episode 5 - "The Written Word"
item.itunes:summary: Jack and Ruth compare notes on books they have read, Blood Meridian, White Noise and The Crying of Lot 49. They discuss what to look for in a trustworthy source and why they choose particular sources of their information over other media outlets.
item.itunes:keywords: Blood Meridian, Cormac McCarthy, White Noise, The Crying of Lot 49
item.itunes:author: Pappin/Mansoor

item.title: Episode 6 - "The Future of Seattle’s Economy "
item.itunes:summary: Ruth and Jack predict the future of Seattle’s economic landscape and discuss teams - Amazon, Expedia, Blue Origin, Microsoft - and the scions of the current industries - Jeff Bezos, Bill Gates, Steve Jobs, Elon Musk and others, all of whom dot the pale green money shaded horizon. Also, how the New York Yankees and Ferrari are the same thing.
item.itunes:keywords: Amazon, Expedia, Blue Origin, Microsoft, Jeff Bezos, Bill Gates, Steve Jobs, Elon Musk, New York Yankees, Ferrari
item.itunes:author: Pappin/Mansoor

item.title: Episode 7 - "Setting Sale"
item.itunes:summary: Jack and Ruth discuss growth hacks in education, Eastern Washington, emotional vs. logical thinking; and how rappers, politicians and salesmen wield the power of influence. Also, they discuss how people could potentially connect authentically with their environment to form a symbiotic exchange and improve the world.
item.itunes:author: Pappin/Mansoor

item.title: Episode 8 - "Over the Next Hill"
item.itunes:summary: Jack and Ruth describe how weekend warriors can enjoy the beautiful Pacific Northwest scenery on a budget: go outside. Everyone in the Northwest wants a their own piece of the Puget Sound area, so where can you find it? Also, Jack tells Ruth about his first love: Baseball.
item.itunes:keywords: Pacific NW, Baseball, Mariners, Tigers, Sports, Future
item.itunes:author: Pappin/Mansoor

item.title: Episode 9 - "Two Sides to Every Reality"
item.itunes:summary: Jack, Ruth and Jequan discuss how the virtual reality devices of tomorrow will alter society. The philosophical conversation begs the question: “Will a virtual world build humanity’s pathway towards telepathy and immortality?” Plus, Jequan talks about a new radio station club at S.C.C. and commuting, where all humans must adapt to survive..
item.itunes:keywords: Virtual Reality, I-5, Telepathy, Immortality, SCC Radio Station
item.itunes:author: Pappin/Mansoor

item.title: Episode 10 - "Music and Mission"
item.itunes:summary: Ruth and Jequan talk about their favorite musicians and the impact music has made on their lives.
item.itunes:author: Hayes/Mansoor

item.title: Episode 11 - "Werk"
item.itunes:summary: Ruth and Jack discuss the many facets of Good Work.
item.itunes:author: Pappin/Mansoor

item.title: Episode 12 - "Our Similarities"
item.itunes:summary: Professor Huma Mohibullah shares some of her ground-breaking research addressing practical considerations of practicing Muslims: we are more similar than we are different.
item.itunes:author: Pappin/Mansoor

item.title: Episode 13 - "Jas' Story"
item.itunes:summary: Seattle Central Student Jas Panag shares his story of fortitude in the pursuit of personal justice.
item.itunes:author: Pappin/Mansoor

item.title: Episode 14 - "Women in Tech"
item.itunes:summary: Seattle Central's Tarah Wheeler Van Vlack speaks about her new book, "Women in Tech", a collaboration with others highlighting feminine perspectives in today's job-market, and ways for women to thrive.
item.itunes:author: Pappin/Mansoor
